I think this link( http://junit.sourceforge.net/doc/cookbook/cookbook.htm
<http://junit.sourceforge.net/doc/cookbook/cookbook.htm> ) does not work any
more. Does any body know the mirror site or they moved this page to where.
 
Thanks.
 
Andrew

-----Original Message-----
From: Philippe Vanpeperstraete [mailto:philippe.vanpeperstraete@...]
Sent: Wednesday, May 30, 2001 11:48 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [junit] testing junit


Did you look under the "documentation" tab, there, you'll find the JUnit
cookbook, which is a pretty good start, if you get your Java environment
straight.
 
regards
Philippe

-----Original Message-----
From: Ram Kumar [mailto:y_ramkumar@...]
Sent: woensdag 30 mei 2001 16:33
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] testing junit



Hi,

I am a new JUnit user and just downloaded JUnit and trying to work with it.
I could not find proper documentation about how to install JUnit and use it,
in JUnit site.

Could any one suggest me where to find good documentation about JUnit?

Awaiting your immediate reply.

Thanks,

Yamasani.
